$interpreted: Phil: Hey, let's pull a prank on them~
Lio: Phil... I-I don't think we should do that...
Phil: Tsk, you're such a coward. Watch!
Phil: Hahaha! Look at those dimwits!
Leah: Phil you idiot, is it that hard for you to NOT get in trouble!
Lio: Woah, it's getting pretty late. I think we should go back?
Phil: Worst case we get chewed out, no big deal. Let's keep playing!
Lio: I-I don't want to make Nigel angry.
Leah: Yeah, ever since Eve left the Slums, he has been especially grumpy. I say that's it for today?
Phil: ...*sigh*...can't stand you two little babies. Alright, alright, let's go home!
Leah: Whew~ good thing it's not Nigel who caught us~
Hyacinthus: There's this story in the Slums. A long time ago, a kid decided to skip work at the dye workshop and go play at Garbage Mountain...
Leah: Cin...why are you telling us this?
Hyacinthus: It was getting dark, and that kid was trying to get back to the Slums. Suddenly, a strange voice appeared behind him, with the words:
Hyacinthus: "Are you a good kid? Or bad kid?"
Hyacinthus: The kid was too scared to reply, so he just ran ahead like there was no tomorrow. After running for some time, he bumped into a large figure.
Hyacinthus: He looked up. Standing in front of him was a freak in an animal suit with a huge~ sack...
Hyacinthus: Looks like, you're a BAD KID! ! ! !
Hyacinthus: The freak reached out and grabbed the kid, then he stuffed the kid into his sack.
Hyacinthus: Three days later, that kid's body was discovered, among the trash piles of Garbage Mountain...
Hyacinthus: You stinkin' brats got lucky that you didn't become dinner for the Ragdoll Coroner!

Leah: That's just a legend. Who the heck would believe it?
Right, Lio? ...... Lio?
Leah: Y-You two are such cowards!
Hyacinthus: Haha, if you really are scared, then don't come back so late the next time!
Lio: By the way, where is Nigel?
Hyacinthus: He's working himself to death just to take care of you brats. The salary from the dye workshop is far from enough.
Leah: He's been acting really weird recently, doesn't really play with Lio anymore too. He seems more into clashing with Eugene these days.
Lio: I'm okay by myself...speaking of Mr. Eugene...
Lio: Phil, is he still giving you a hard time?
Phil: Same as always. Chewing me out for not doing my job properly; Sometimes he hits me.
Hyacinthus: That damn bastard, so he's still acting like a scumbag...
Hyacinthus: If he continues to pick on you, tell me. Even if Nigel is not here, I'll make sure justice is served!
Phil: I can take care of myself just fine. No worries!
Lio: Be careful.
Leah: Lio, I'm tired. Let's go back to the house and rest.
Lio: Eh? W-Wait for me!

Model.Text: Hey, let's pull a prank on them~
Phil... I-I don't think we should do that...
Tsk, you're such a coward. Watch!
Hahaha! Look at those dimwits!
Phil you idiot, is it that hard for you to NOT get in trouble!
Woah, it's getting pretty late. I think we should go back?
Worst case we get chewed out, no big deal. Let's keep playing!
I-I don't want to make Nigel angry.
Yeah, ever since Eve left the Slums, he has been especially grumpy. I say that's it for today?
...*sigh*...can't stand you two little babies. Alright, alright, let's go home!
Whew~ good thing it's not Nigel who caught us~
There's this story in the Slums. A long time ago, a kid decided to skip work at the dye workshop and go play at Garbage Mountain...
Cin...why are you telling us this?
It was getting dark, and that kid was trying to get back to the Slums. Suddenly, a strange voice appeared behind him, with the words:
"Are you a good kid? Or bad kid?"
The kid was too scared to reply, so he just ran ahead like there was no tomorrow. After running for some time, he bumped into a large figure.
He looked up. Standing in front of him was a freak in an animal suit with a huge~ sack...
Looks like, you're a BAD KID! ! ! !
The freak reached out and grabbed the kid, then he stuffed the kid into his sack.
Three days later, that kid's body was discovered, among the trash piles of Garbage Mountain...
You stinkin' brats got lucky that you didn't become dinner for the Ragdoll Coroner!

That's just a legend. Who the heck would believe it?
Right, Lio? ...... Lio?
Y-You two are such cowards!
Haha, if you really are scared, then don't come back so late the next time!
By the way, where is Nigel?
He's working himself to death just to take care of you brats. The salary from the dye workshop is far from enough.
He's been acting really weird recently, doesn't really play with Lio anymore too. He seems more into clashing with Eugene these days.
I'm okay by myself...speaking of Mr. Eugene...
Phil, is he still giving you a hard time?
Same as always. Chewing me out for not doing my job properly; Sometimes he hits me.
That damn bastard, so he's still acting like a scumbag...
If he continues to pick on you, tell me. Even if Nigel is not here, I'll make sure justice is served!
I can take care of myself just fine. No worries!
Be careful.
Lio, I'm tired. Let's go back to the house and rest.
Eh? W-Wait for me!
